caption:
This photograph features a large, colorful advertising billboard standing prominently against a natural background. The billboard is structured in two parts and mounted on two sturdy, reddish-brown wooden poles. The top part of the billboard is a directional sign painted in a bright yellow background with bold, black text stating "TURN LEFT 3 1/2 Mi." alongside indicating "6 Mi. North of Key West Tamarac Park." The bottom half of the billboard, separated by a horizontal line, advertises "WATERFRONT MOBILE HOMESITES" in black text on a yellow background with "MOBILE HOMES ON DISPLAY" and "BIG SALE" emphasized in larger type. The phrase "Early Terms" is also visible in smaller print.

The backdrop of the image features a stormy sky, cast in grey, suggesting an impending or current poor weather condition. Below the skyline, there is a stretch of dense, lush greenery, predominantly shrubs or small trees, that forms a natural horizon line. On the left side of the photograph, slightly below the level of the sign, a single white bird is perched atop one of the trees, adding a touch of natural life to the scene. Overall, the image captures a juxtaposition between human commercial endeavor and the natural environment.
title: A typical developer's sign in the Florida Keys
